conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C.
Point A: The liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point A: It then continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point A: Finally flows into container E.
Point B: The liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point B: It then continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point B: Finally flows into container E.
Point C: The liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point C: It then continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point C: Finally flows into container E.

premise: All three points (A, B, and C) direct the liquid flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
conclusion: The liquid will flow into container E.
